subject: Re: [junit] Creating MockObjects from Classes with Static Methods
msgSnippet: ... Some of us who use Mock Objects think that they re most useful as a technique for driving your design. Static methods are hard to replace for unit testing,
messageBody:
rodoherty1 wrote:
> I've been spending some time lately trying to familiarise myself with
> MockObjects. I've learned quite a bit but I'm having trouble
> creating MockObjects from Classes that use Static Methods.

Some of us who use Mock Objects think that they're most useful as a
technique for driving your design. Static methods are hard to replace
for unit testing, which suggests that maybe their use is problematic.

<nostalgia>
of course, in Smalltalk, you can override class methods because classes
are objects too. Sigh.
</nostalgia>

A couple of solutions are to move the static methods to the instance
side so you can attach them to an interface. Alternatively, create a
little object that wraps the static code. Usually this leads you to
creating a context type that gets passed around and turns out to be
Really Useful Object (Sorry, been reading Thomas The Tank Engine to my
kid again).

Steve
